stem: A volleyball player develops dull posterior shoulder pain and weakness in external rotation. Atrophy is noted in the infraspinatus, while the deltoid is normal. Which structure is compressing the affected nerve?
rationale_correct: Compression of the suprascapular nerve at the spinoglenoid notch selectively weakens the infraspinatus causing external rotation deficits with sparing of the supraspinatus and deltoid.

rationale_distractors.B: Quadrangular space compression affects the axillary nerve, leading to deltoid weakness.
rationale_distractors.C: Triangular interval lesions involve the radial nerve causing triceps weakness.
rationale_distractors.D: Coracoacromial arch impingement causes rotator cuff tendon irritation, not isolated infraspinatus atrophy.
rationale_distractors.E: Cubital tunnel syndromes impact the ulnar nerve at the elbow, unrelated to shoulder pain.
